name: Rome in the Age of Bernini
description: Architecture, urbanism, and multi-media ensembles of Baroque Rome under Urban VIII, Alexander VII, and Innocent X. With particular emphasis on the work of Borromini and Bernini in palace architecture, churches, piazzas, fountains and at the Vatican. [24S]ÿMay be taken for credit for the Specialist/Major programs in Religion (U of T Mississauga), Christianity & Culture (St. George), and Architecture (St. George).
